channel.title: Erasedpkz change item stats?
channel.description:
I changed them in the item.cfg file, compiled it then logged back on and unchanged.
Yes i restarted the server!
[IMG]http://i1220.photobucket.com/albums/dd448/laakerules/error.png[/img]

item.title: Erasedpkz change item stats?
item.dc:creator: @kickingjamie kickingjamie
item.description:
@kickingjamie wrote:

run3scap3_uk:

You said you ‘Restarted’ your server, but did you compile proper?

You don’t need to compile when you change cfg. files so either way thats irrelevent.

Read full topic

item.title: Erasedpkz change item stats?
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“CreatorAlex, post:7, topic:426489”]Do you know for sure if the server loads item.cfg at startup?

It may have been loaded once and then removed, thus the stats stay the way they were.[/quote]

It’d probably throw an exception if it wasn’t loading a CFG.

Read full topic

item.title: Erasedpkz change item stats?
item.dc:creator: @laakerules laakerules
item.description:
@laakerules wrote:

Lol Run3scap3 ive been doing RSPS for along time! Im 100% sure i compiled rite!

This is in itemdef2.java


	if (i == 15179) {
      itemDef.modelID = 5412;
      itemDef.name = "Ultimate Whip";
      itemDef.modelZoom = 840;
      itemDef.modelRotation1 = 280;
      itemDef.modelRotation2 = 0;
      itemDef.modelOffset1 = 1;
      itemDef.modelOffset2 = -3;

      itemDef.value = 1;
      itemDef.membersObject = true;
      itemDef.maleEquip1 = 5409;
      itemDef.femaleEquip1 = 5409;
      itemDef.actions = new String[5];
      itemDef.actions[1] = "Wear";
      itemDef.actions[4] = "Drop";
      itemDef.editedModelColor = new int[18];

      itemDef.newModelColor[17] = 127;
	}
